title: Loblaw resets passwords after security breach of its loyalty program - Toronto - CBC News
text:
Loblaw resets passwords after security breach of its loyalty program Company will reimburse those people whose points were stolen The Canadian Press Posted: Feb 20, 2017 9:59 PM ET Last Updated: Feb 20, 2017 10:01 PM ET Loblaw will reimburse those customers whose loyalty points were stolen during a recent security breach. (Aaron Vincent Elkaim/Canadian Press) Related Stories PC Points Plus members urged to change password after hack 
Loblaw has reset passwords for all its PC Plus rewards collectors' online accounts after points were stolen from some members' accounts. 
The company posted a warning on its website saying it requires all members to create new passwords â€” regardless of whether or not they changed them following the recent security breach. Loblaw advises PC Plus points members to change passwords after hack 
Earlier this month, Loblaw urged members to create unique, secure passwords after some people noticed their points were missing. 
The company said at the time that the breach stemmed from people using favourite or weak username and password combinations across multiple sites. Those were stolen from other sites and used to access PC Plus accounts. 
The company said it's reimbursing members whose points were stolen.
